instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight at all
threads.message:
Hi Guys, 
No water or whatever liquid and board looks pretty clean, however, no backlight

Here is some measurements:

J8300
Pin 1 = 0
Pin 3-4 = 5
Pin 6-7 = 3.4V
Pin 28 and 30 = 5V

F7700 = 12V

<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>
Pin 5-8 = 5V
Pin 17-18= 0V


<RESISTOR>R7744</RESISTOR> - 5V
<CAPACITOR>C7744</CAPACITOR> = 5V

<TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>
3-4 = 12V


L7720
1 = 5
2 = 0

<CAPACITOR>C7720</CAPACITOR>
1 = 5V

<DIODE>D7720</DIODE>
1 = 5V
2 = 5V

Any hint ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight at all
threads.message:
"L7720
1 = 5
2 = 0
---------
<DIODE>D7720</DIODE>
1 = 5V
2 = 5V"
That is impossible!
There is keyboard backlight circuit, but now I'm not sure if you didn't make an error on LCD backlight circuit too.
Please provide accurate information...

Recheck <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> voltage, at least pin 18.
Do you get image for sure, just missing backlight?
Any USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight at all
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>
Pin 5-8 = 5V
Pin 17 0V
Pin 18 5V

Chime and Mouse OK

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight at all
threads.message:
"Do you get image for sure, just missing backlight?"
???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight at all
threads.message: I can see the question mark, however, i don't have the back light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight at all
threads.message:
I figure out. The problem was <CAPACITOR>C7715</CAPACITOR> ( short )
Everything works with the backlight. However, won't hold the battery.
Looks like is charging, but when i pull the charger the computer shut down
I did the hardware test (D) and NO ISSUES.

Lost again!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight at all
threads.message:
OSX recognizes the battery?
Does it show percentage, or some "Replace now" message?
